div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 121px; margin-left: 138px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Turn on LED,
Lock power,
Light sleep for 30ms

background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: Menlo, Monaco, "Courier New", monospace; font-size: 13px; line-height: 20px;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 404px; margin-left: 138px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Get saved control status, toggle it and save it,
Initiate send(status),
task_state = STATE_DONE

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 411px; margin-left: 349px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
When sending the control status:
initiator_attribute:
ESPNOW_ATTRIBUTE_KEY_1,
responder_attribute: ESPNOW_ATTRIBUTE_POWER,
responder_value: status
Note: By default status is not saved and read. The status
persistence can be enabled by setting
CONFIG_EXAMPLE_SWITCH_STATUS_PERSISTED to y.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 570px; margin-left: 217px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 198px; height: 1px; padding-top: 516px; margin-left: 118px;

background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 20px;
background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: Menlo, Monaco, "Courier New", monospace; font-size: 13px; line-height: 20px;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 621px; margin-left: 138px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Light sleep for 30ms,
Unlock power,
Turn off LED,
Light sleep for 2s

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 621px; margin-left: 348px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
When power is unlocked, if button is not kept pressed,
the device will lose power and off. If after this block the
task is still running, that means the button is still kept
pressed.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 201px; margin-left: 138px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 121px; margin-left: 349px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
When power is locked, power system stays connected
even if button is release.
When device is in light sleep, device consumes very
little current. On the other hand, since power system is
connected, coin cell battery continuously charges the
capacitor. This ensures there's maximum power to
perform the tasks that follows.
Note that it takes about 30ms to almost fully charge the
capacitor. Spending more time in light sleep will not gain
significant more charge.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 726px; margin-left: 138px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

Lock power,
Turn on LED,
task_state = STATE_

Light sleep for 30ms,
Unlock power,
Turn off LED,
Light sleep for 2s

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 957px; margin-left: 1009px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
div.span:
Since task_state is not changed, no task will be executed
even if button is kept pressed.

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
